column1: Thus,  the provisions relating  to revision,  in  chapter XXIX  of the Code of

column2: Criminal  Procedure Act No.  15 of 1979, as  well  as  in  chapter LVIII of the

column1: Civil  Procedure Code  have been  made applicable to the exercise of

column2: revisionary jurisdiction  by the Provincial  High  Courts in  respect of this kind

column1: of orders made  by the  Primary Court Judges.

column2: According to section  364 of the Code of Criminal  Procedure Act,  as well  as

column1: section  753  of the Civil  Procedure Code,  the Court exercising  revisionary
jurisdiction, can  call  for and examine the record  of any case  for the
purpose of satisfying  itself as to the legality or propriety of any order
passed  therein or as to the regularity of the proceedings of such  Court.
Thus, three aspects which a Court could  consider in  revisionary
proceedings have been  specified  in  both the above sections. They are

column2: regularity of the proceedings of such  Court.
